p: QS systems control the pathogenesis of living organisms, regulating gene expression, and enabling the development of new anti-infective agents without dependence on antibiotics. Anti-QS compounds are known to inhibit bacterial pathogenicity. More specifically, certain plant extracts, including phenolic compounds, quinones, flavonoids, alkaloids, terpenoids, and polyacetylenes, can effectively and safely inhibit QS. For example, McClean et al. [ 16] identified a clear relationship between C. violaceum and anti-QS activity.
